page.title: 19Birds of Mount Farm Lake
page.content: Mount Farm Lake was a gravel pit until it was abandoned in 1937.Then in 1974 M.K.D.C.landscaped it.Now it is fairly shallow and there are many fish.There is a large island for nesting and a small one that used to be a fishing platform.The lake is open water surrounded by a belt of reeds and a few trees.Water from nearby roads drains into the lake which means that salt and oil are dangers, though there are oil barriers. Facilities for people are a pub, playground,picnics,walking and fishing. Birds nesting in 1985-Canada Geese, Mallard,Moorhen,Coot,Great Crested Grebe and Reed Warbler.Other birds spotted in 1985-Mute Swan,Tufted Duck, Heron,Shoveller,Pochard and Reed Bunting.
